docs.lead_paragraph: A GOOD case could be made for the short story being the most flexible of all forms and, as such, the key to "modernism": it can accommodate everything from the prose poem to the well-made plot, allows for the undercurrents that emanated from Vienna in the 1920's, the seemingly formless but beautifully ...
